title: What are the courses I can study after 12th computer science? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are so many options are there, but I will suggest 2. Engineering - If you have creative mind and if you think that you are very good in mathematics then you go for engineering. You can select any one branch of engineering as your career, depending upon your interest you can take admission for it.Computer/IT EngineeringElectronics EngineeringCivil EngineeringMechanical EnginneringElectronics and Telecommunication EngineeringProduction EngineeringEnvironmental EngineeringBiotechnology EngineeringChemical EngineeringTextile EngineeringAerospace EngineeringAgricultural EngineeringAutomotive EngineeringAutomobile Engineering ……….etc2. BSc/BCA - This is secondary option as a career. If you are not that much creative then this is best option for you. This is also not an bad option, BSc - offers theoretical as well as practical knowledge about different subject areas. These subject areas usually include any one of the main Science fields (Physics, Chemistry, and Biology) and other fields depending on the specialization a student opts. Pursuing a BSc course is most beneficial for students who have a strong interest and background in Science and Mathematics. The course is also beneficial for students who wish to pursue multi and inter-disciplinary science careers in future.BCA - It is one of the popular courses among the students who want to make their career in the IT (Information Technology) field. The duration of the course is 3 years and divided into 6 semesters. It comprises of the subjects like database, networking, data structure, core programming languages like ‘C’ and ‘java’. This course provides a lot of opportunities to the students who are interested in computer field and wants to work in the IT sector as programmer or software developer.

computer science courses after 12th are available in various formats. Some of the notable formats are – Certificate coursesVocational training coursesDiploma coursesBachelor’s Degree coursesCertificate, vocational, diploma and Bachelor’s Degree courses are UG (undergraduate) level courses. Students who have passed 10+2 are eligible to pursue this course. BACHELOR’S DEGREE COURSES B.E or B.Tech in computer scienceB.E. or B.Tech. in Computer EngineeringB.E. or B.Tech. in Software EngineeringB.E. or B.Tech. in Computer Science and EngineeringB.E. or B.Tech. Computer and Communication EngineeringIntegrated (B.E./B.Tech. + M.E./M.Tech.) Computer EngineeringBCA (Bachelor of computer application)B. Sc in computer scienceB. Sc. in Computer EngineeringB. Sc. in Software TechnologyDIPLOMA COURSES Diploma in Computer EngineeringDiploma in Software EngineeringDiploma in Computer TechnologyDiploma in Computer Hardware TechnologyDiploma in Hardware and NetworkingDiploma in Computer Science and EngineeringCAREER PROSPECTS Some of the prime recruiters are – Software companiesMNCs (Technical support wing)MNCs (IT wing)IT companiesBanksConsultanciesEducational institutesRelevant Government departmentsInstitutions that offer these courses are:- Delhi College of Engineering PSG Technology Coimbatore National Institute of Engineering, Mysore Lovely professional university NSIT, New Delhi

If you are talking about formal education. 1 There are 4 years professional courses BE/BTech in Computer Science. These are offered by almost 6000 colleges in India (including the prestigious Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs). India produces about 10 lacs engineers every year. 10% of that are Comp Sc engineers. Salaries after finishing the course ranges from 2.25lacs/annum to 25 lac per annum (if you are a Comp Sc Engg from the top 4 IIT's) 3 There are also 3 year BSc and BCA courses available in India. These are not recognized out side India. So if you wish to do your MS or MBA abroad, you will need to the BE during your graduation or a MSc or MCA for 1 yr after BSc / BCA. Jobs after doing BSc/BCA are low end IT jobs (BPO companies). A good way to start learning programming is Scratch - Imagine, Program, Share This has been developed by Massachusetts Institute of Technology Then if you are interested in Robotics, you can try your hands on Arduino - Home micro-controller. Else if you just wish go the boring old way to learn programming then you can learn C, C++, Java & Visual Basic. This will help in making your programming fundamentals strong. Then you can move to PHP, python (web technologies) & android programming.

Computer Science Engineering and Information Technology drive the world and has become an indispensable part of human civilization. For every learned individual, it is an asset for the knowledge economy. Computer Science Engineering not only grooms research scientists who have a passion for invention and novel design of new technology and explore new vistas for the use of existing technology. For your information, I listed out some programme in the field of computer. You can select any discipline according to your interest. B. Tech (Computer Science Engineering): An Engineering program which seamlessly articulates the concepts from basic science to technology with relevant practice through lab and projects for building the problem solving skills, keeping industry requirements in place. Students will develop competence in areas like Programming, Database Management Systems, Networks and Security, Operating Systems, Cloud Computing etc. BCA: The program is designed to build programing skills for developing efficient and resource optimized software/website/cloud/mobile applications. Dual Degree BCA-MCA: Designed for learners intend to construct strong basic conceptions and then hone their understanding in a specific domain with the assimilation and implementation through industry internship. BCA (Hons.): The focus during the tenure is kept on the latest need by upgrading the curriculum almost every term and then designing problems for learners based on the current scenario in technology. Presently the emphasis is on mobile application development/pervasive computing. Dual Degree BCA (Hons.) -MCA (Hons.): Designed for learners intend to construct strong basic conceptions and then hone their understanding in a specific domain with the assimilation and implementation through industry internship. B. Sc. (Information Technology): Constructing strong basic foundation in concepts of information technology for crafting developers with latest platforms for futuristic needs. B. Sc. (Computer Science): Constructing strong basic foundation in concepts of computation for crafting developers with latest platforms for futuristic needs. Top universities which offering this course: University of Hyderabad Annamalai University Lovely Professional University, Jalandhar Osmania University Uttar Pradesh Technical University Madhya Pradesh Bhoj Open University

Possible career/learning paths BCA -> MCA-> specialize in anyone domain like:Machine learning/AI/DL/NLPBig DataWeb developmentParallel programmingData ScienceBTech (CSE) -> MTech (CSE)-> specialize according to your interestBSc computer science + math+ physics-> MSc computer scienceBSc computer+math+statistics -> MS in Data Science & AnalyticsBSc IT -> MS ITStraight away (after 12th, without spening time in graduation) do some professional certifications like :OCJP - Oracle certified Java programmerMCSD - Microsoft Certified Solutions DeveloperAWS certified developer web developerRHCJD - Red Hat Certified JBoss DeveloperCCDH - Cloudera certified Developer for Apache Hadoop

List of Best Computer Courses after 12th; 1. Data Entry Operator Course 2. MS Office Certification Program 3. Animation & VFX 4. Web Designing & Development 5. Digital Marketing 6. Graphic Designing 7. CADD (Computer Aided Design & Drafting) 8. Mobile Application Development 9. Computer Hardware Repairing/Maintenance

Greetings! The computer stream is a vast field and there a lot of options to choose from. If you are very inclined towards software then you should go for IT or else go for the Computer Science Engineering where you will learn both the technologies. This part is the most important as the road becomes clearer from this stage. You can become a System Programmer or a Web Developer or you could be a Security Professional or you can go for Machine Learning which is on trending nowadays. There is no end to the possibilities in this field. All you need is to develop your interest in a certain field and for that you have to start loving the machine !

Always search for enhancing your ‘helicopter’ quality. What is this? Your ability to master details AND to hoover over details for your insight. A helicopter can go vertical instantanuously for the necessary overview of what you are doing/learning/experiencing. After your 12th you first should climb to a higher level by reading some algorithmic studies (stead of the Nuts and Bolts of computing via the programming languages). You also find these via MOOCS in Coursera. An advanced example? Take the Nijenhuis and Wilf book on the Analysis of combinatoral algorithms. Combinatorics is a very useful subject anyway, because these problems are ubiquitous.

Hi, Since you have completed class 12th examination from a CBSE or from other boards and looking for courses to pursue higher education in computer science stream. The most eligible option are as follows :- B.tech in Computer science or in information technology. This will helps to build carrer opportunity for you.B.sc. in compuer science or in information technology.BCAB.VOC in applied computer science.You can also apply for other certificate courses for enhancing your knowledge in Computer stream like Cloud computing, Java, Hadoop, Android programming, Javascript, IT security management, IOT etc.

So if you are passed out 12th class then you should start machine learning course firstly you should known about programming language for ex:- python. If you are build career in machine learning and artificial intelligence please click on these link are shown in the below Machine Learning | Coursera Intro to Machine Learning 13 Free Training Courses on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence There are some picture of power machine learning and AI

After 12th computer science , there are many options to do related to computers like B.Tech , BCA , BSC , IMCA (Integrated master of computer application i.e bachelors + masters) and IMSC (Integrated master of computer science i.e bachelors + masters). So if you are deciding to choose computer fields, then choose wisely according to your interest.

A BE or a BS in Computer Engineering/ Computer Sciences is a great undergrad option — you could take up specialized courses while you are at it — and pursue a masters in a niche domain. However, an undergrad degree is best kept a little broad in purview so that you have the knowledge and deciding capacity for what you want to narrow down on from an array of fields and specialize in. You could follow this up with a specialization in analytics , AI dev, Augmented Reality dev (game development) or statistics — apart from the regular cloud computing, high performance computing and general software dev and coding. If you are interested in studying abroad — check out campus options and other relevant details at icudb.com

basically those who opt cs in 12 goes for engineering …if you are interested you can go for it…….or else there are many options left such as bsc degree bsc maths bsc physics bsc chemistry if u wish to pursue with computer related subject BCA or ……arts ………how about it??…..literature ….language….. just in brief you can go for all the courses except medicine and biology related subjects ….even you can go for commerce subjects like B.Com BBA and 1 more thing understand that all the courses has its own merit and demerits …no course is that good and that bad ….it depends on your wish and taste .and dont depend on others word… DO…. WHAT YOU FEEL AS RIGHT..— ALL THE BEST

It depends on what you really like. If you like competitve coding and similar type of thing then you can do BCA , MCA If you are good at designing and stuff like Photoshop, CorelDraw then you can persue B.Des (Bachelor of Design) If you are interested in Cyber Security stuffs then you can persue B.Tech in Cyber Security field. There are few colleges in India including IIIT Allahabad. You may have to search for you interests and think accordingly.

Logically,B.E/B.tech in Computer Science. But I would suggest do not select this field based on “good” course,but do figure out if you have any interests/passions that align with it(Since with CS you can later specialize in fields like A.I,data analytics ,cloud computing etc) Interested in such courses? Go ahead. Haven't figured it out? No problem.Very few know what they want to do in life before college.

After finishing the 12th of Computer Science, we have many options. The first thing we should do is to set our own goals. I like what I have to know what I can do. After 12th, we can do BSC, MSC, IMCA & B .Tech. And I think, it should be done by itself and should remain firm in its own conclusions.

Depends entirely on what you want to do in life. Also, you have not mentioned if you had Science stream or Commerce stream (because even that could include Computer Science). You can do anything! Engineering, Medical, Honors, NDA, Military what not! Choose wisely. A knowledge of Computer Science would definitely help you.

You can study whatever you want to and you are intrested in if you are intrested in CS then you can go for BCA,BSc (IT),B.tech,BE or if you have any other intrests then you can adjust your goals according to them. Thank You!!

The stamp of engineer BE/B.Tech has much weighted. Check a good college which does 100% placements. There are many such good colleges. Important : Let’s try to be practical “how most of studies programming till 12th is an important factor”. Most of the beginners work hard to master syntax and features of a programming language.Actual confidence in coding comes by developing the skill of logic building for a program. Once you get a solid grip over logic building skills, then learning advance topics of a program and learning any other programming will be with confidence. How can I improve my programming skills?

If there is a course which you can think of where in which failure, not getting placed, people’s judgement about you don’t matter as much as the fun you get doing it. That’s the path you should take. If you feel that computer science is fun regardless of CGPA, hefty payrolls from MNCs, etc..then you should opt CSE for sure. Remember success is a path,not a destination.

Go for BSc. In computer science.. I am a student of this particular stream and i can understand the fruitfulness of studing this subject in bachelor degree. After completing Bsc. u can also opt for MSc. / MCA which will add another feather in the cap. Becoz there is a huge demand of MSc. Or MCA nowadays in private sectors.
You can opt for BE in computer engineering or BTech in computer science and engineering or BCA as per your choice..

You can pursue BE or Btech in your interested specialisation like CS or EEE or EC etc . Or you can even take http://B.sc in computer science . Mind you , these courses will be useful only if you do in top universities

Try to get admission in a good university with great faculty and teaching background and learn software engineering and computer sciences subjects. If it is not possible, start gaining knowledge about worldwide CS certifications, that are mostly more recommended than Degrees, like MCITP, MCSE, MCSA, CCNA, CCNP, CISSP, CBTE, etc. they are huge in numbers and great in demand.

If you are interested in learning about computers and are from India, pursuing a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering is a good idea. response.answer_text: B tech

Learn Discrete Math, Linear Algebra, and Data Structures. These courses teach you to manipulate discrete buffers of data in the most efficient way possible. It’s also good to take Operating Systems/Computer Architecture for context.

Better you can carry on the same field of computer science because now a days more placements or otherwise choose your interested area. Before going admission think about the best colleges/University like as IIT, NIT , LPU … All the best .
